bitfields.name: DEFAULT_BOOT_SOURCE
bitfields.description: Default Boot Source

values.name: AUTO_BOOT
values.description: Auto boot similar to ISP auto boot option

bitfields.name: DEFAULT_ISP_MODE
bitfields.description: Default ISP mode

bitfields.name: BOOT_SPEED
bitfields.description: Boot Speed Core Clock

bitfields.name: ASRT_FATAL
bitfields.description: Assert on fatal errors. When set ROM drives BOOT_FAIL_PIN high when fatal error condition occurs on three attempts to boot image before locking the part

bitfields.name: ASRT_RBF
bitfields.description: Assert on recovery boot. When this bit is set ROM drives the BOOT_FAIL_PIN high whenever no valid image is found in primary boot media and execution enters recovery boot mode from secondary boot media

bitfields.name: ASRT_ISPF
bitfields.description: Assert on ISP fall through. When this bit is set ROM drives BOOT_FAIL_PIN high whenever there is no valid image in boot media and execution falls through to ISP mode

bitfields.name: BOOT_FAILURE_PIN
bitfields.description: GPIO port and pin number to use for indicating failure reason. The toggle rate of the pin is used to decode the error type. [2:0] - Defines GPIO port [7:3] - Defines GPIO pin

bitfields.name: SPI_RECOVERY_BOOT_EN
bitfields.description: REC_BOOT_EN SPI flash recovery boot is enabled, if non-zero value is written to this field

bitfields.name: SPI_REC_IF
bitfields.description: Recovery SPI interface

bitfields.name: CAN_BAUD_RATE
bitfields.description: CAN baud rate. Baud rate configured during CAN ISP mode

bitfields.name: USB_VENDOR_ID
bitfields.description: USB Vendor ID

bitfields.name: USB_PRODUCT_ID
bitfields.description: USB Product ID

bitfields.name: POWERDOWN_TIMEOUT_SECS
bitfields.description: Power-down timeout: Timeout value in seconds. When a non-zero value is programmed in this field ROM uses it as idle timeout value to enter power-down state to conserve power

bitfields.name: WDOG_TIMEOUT_SECS
bitfields.description: WDOG timeout: Timeout value in seconds. When a non-zero value is programmed in this field ROM configures the watch dog timer to reset the device on timeout before passing execution control to user code

registers.name: DCFG_CC_SOCU_PIN
registers.description: Device Configuration Credential Constraints for SoC specific Use Pinned. Combinations of PIN and DFLT bits and resulting restriction level: - PIN=1,DFLT=1: Restriction level 0. Access to the sub-domain is always enabled. This setting is provided for module use case scenario where DCFG_CC_SOCU_NS would be used to define further access restrictions before final deployment of the product. - PIN=0,DFLT=0: Restriction level 1. Access to the sub-domain is disabled at startup. But the access can be enabled through the debug authentication process by providing an appropriate Debug Credential (DC) certificate. - PIN=0,DFLT=1: Illegal setting. Part may lock-up if this setting is selected. - PIN=1,DFLT=0: Restriction level 2. Access to the sub-domain is permanently disabled and cannot be reversed. This setting offers the highest level of restriction.

bitfields.name: NIDEN
bitfields.description: Non Secure non-invasive debug enable

bitfields.name: DBGEN
bitfields.description: Non Secure debug enable

bitfields.name: ISP_CMD_EN
bitfields.description: ISP boot command enable

bitfields.name: FA_CMD_EN
bitfields.description: FA Command Enable

bitfields.name: ME_CMD_EN
bitfields.description: Flash Mass Erase Command Enable

bitfields.name: UUID_CHECK
bitfields.description: Enforce UUID match during Debug authentication

bitfields.name: INVERSE_VALUE
bitfields.description: Inverse Value

registers.name: DCFG_CC_SOCU_DFLT
registers.description: Device Configuration Credential Constraints for SoC specific Use Debug Filter. Combinations of PIN and DFLT bits and resulting restriction level: - PIN=1,DFLT=1: Restriction level 0. Access to the sub-domain is always enabled. This setting is provided for module use case scenario where DCFG_CC_SOCU_NS would be used to define further access restrictions before final deployment of the product. - PIN=0,DFLT=0: Restriction level 1. Access to the sub-domain is disabled at startup. But the access can be enabled through the debug authentication process by providing an appropriate Debug Credential (DC) certificate. - PIN=0,DFLT=1: Illegal setting. Part may lock-up if this setting is selected. - PIN=1,DFLT=0: Restriction level 2. Access to the sub-domain is permanently disabled and cannot be reversed. This setting offers the highest level of restriction.

bitfields.description: ISP command Fixed state

bitfields.name: FA_CMD_EN
bitfields.description: Set FA mode command Fixed state

bitfields.name: ME_CMD_EN
bitfields.description: Mass erase flash command fixed state

bitfields.name: INVERSE_VALUE
bitfields.description: Inverse Value

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_AUTO_PROBE_EN
bitfields.description: Quad/Octal-SPI flash auto probe feature enable

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_PROBE_TYPE
bitfields.description: Quad/Octal-SPI flash probe type

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_FLASH_TYPE
bitfields.description: Define typical Serial NOR Flash types

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_DUMMY_CYCLES
bitfields.description: Quad/Octal-SPI dummy cycles for read command

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_FREQUENCY
bitfields.description: Q/O-SPI flash interface frequency

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_RESET_ENABLE
bitfields.description: Use QSPI_RESET_PIN to reset the flash device

values.name: NO_RESET
values.description: NO_RESET(O/QSPI device reset pin is not connected or available.)

values.name: ENABLE_RESET
values.description: EN_RESET(O/QSPI device reset pin is connected to a GPIO (QSPI_RESET_PIN).)

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_RESET_GPIO_PORT
bitfields.description: GPIO port number to use for O/QSPI reset function

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_RESET_GPIO_PIN
bitfields.description: GPIO pin number to use for O/QSPI reset function

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_HOLD_TIME
bitfields.description: Wait time before access to Serial Flash

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_PWR_HOLD_TIME
bitfields.description: Delay after POR before accessing Quad/Octal-SPI flash devices in addition to delay defined by FLEXSPI_HOLD TIME field

bitfields.name: PIN_SLEW_RATE
bitfields.description: Enable faster slew rate. When this bit is set ROM will configure FlexSPI pin with faster slew rate instead of standard slew rate

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_DELAY_CELL_NUM
bitfields.description: Delay cell numbers for Flash read sampling via DQS (either internal loopback or external DQS)

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_IMAGE_OFFSET
bitfields.description: Any offset in memory mapped Q/Octal-SPI Flash area could be remapped to offset zero to support eXecute In Place (XIP) of image programmed at different offset. This allows to build all update images with same RO base address, which are programmed at offset 0 or higher offset. FlLEXSPI_IMAGE_OFFSET field specifies the offset location of second image. FLEXSPI_IMAGE_SIZE field specifies the size multiple to determine the size of area to be remapped. If this field is left blank boot ROM assumes that application intends to not use redundant image boot feature. The physical flash offset is computed as below: physical offset = FLEXSPI_IMAGE_OFFSET

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_REMAP_IMAGE_SIZE
bitfields.description: Any offset in memory mapped QSPI Flash area could be remapped to offset zero to support eXecute In Place (XIP) of image programmed at different offset. This allows to build all update images with same RO base address, which are programmed at offset 0 or higher offset. QSPI_IMAGE_OFFSET field specifies the offset location of second image. QSPI_IMAGE_SIZE field specifies the size multiple to determine the size of area to be remapped. SIZE_OFFSET "Size of the remapped area (aka second half) is same as first half. It is determined by FLEXSPI_IMAGE_OFFSET Field. Remap size = FLEXSPI_IMAGE_OFFSET

values.name: SIZE_1MB
values.description: SIZE_1MB Size of remapped area is 1MByte

values.name: SIZE_2MB
values.description: SIZE_2MB Size of remapped area is 2MByte
